# Support

Thank you for using TypeScript Utility Types! This document provides information on how to get help with the library.

## Getting Help

### üìö Documentation

Before asking for help, please check:

- **[README.md](../README.md)** - Comprehensive documentation with examples
- **[API Documentation](../docs/)** - Detailed type documentation (generated by TypeDoc)
- **Source Code** - All types include JSDoc comments explaining their purpose

### üí¨ Discussions

For general questions, ideas, or discussions:

- **[GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/kylepillay/typescript-utility-types/discussions)** - Ask questions, share ideas, or discuss the library
- **Categories**:
  - üí° **Ideas** - Suggest new utility types or features
  - üôè **Q&A** - Ask questions about using the library
  - üì£ **Show and Tell** - Share how you're using the library
  - üí¨ **General** - General discussions

### üêõ Bug Reports

If you've found a bug:

1. **Search existing issues** to see if it's already reported
2. **Use the bug report template** when creating a new issue
3. **Provide a minimal reproduction** - this helps us fix it faster
4. **Include version information** - TypeScript version, Node version, package version

[Report a Bug ‚Üí](https://github.com/kylepillay/typescript-utility-types/issues/new?template=bug_report.yml)

### ‚ú® Feature Requests

Have an idea for a new utility type?

1. **Check if it already exists** in the library or TypeScript's built-in types
2. **Search existing issues** to avoid duplicates
3. **Use the feature request template** when creating a new issue
4. **Explain the use case** - why is this utility type needed?

[Request a Feature ‚Üí](https://github.com/kylepillay/typescript-utility-types/issues/new?template=feature_request.yml)

## Common Questions

### How do I use a specific utility type?

Check the README for examples of each utility type. Each type includes:
- Description of what it does
- Code examples
- Use cases

### Which TypeScript version do I need?

- **Minimum**: TypeScript 3.0
- **Recommended**: TypeScript 5.x for best compatibility
- **Testing**: We test against TypeScript 3.x, 4.x, and 5.x

### Can I contribute?

Yes! We welcome contributions. Please read our [Contributing Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md) to get started.

### How do I report a security vulnerability?

Please see our [Security Policy](SECURITY.md) for information on reporting security issues.

## Response Times

We aim to respond to:

- **Security issues**: Within 48 hours
- **Bug reports**: Within 1 week
- **Feature requests**: Within 2 weeks
- **Questions**: Within 1 week

Please note that this is an open-source project maintained by volunteers, so response times may vary.

## Community Guidelines

When seeking support:

- ‚úÖ **Be respectful** - Follow our [Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- ‚úÖ **Be clear** - Provide context and examples
- ‚úÖ **Be patient** - Maintainers are volunteers
- ‚úÖ **Search first** - Check if your question has been answered
- ‚úÖ **Give back** - Help others when you can

## Additional Resources

### TypeScript Resources

- [TypeScript Handbook](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/intro.html)
- [TypeScript Deep Dive](https://basarat.gitbook.io/typescript/)
- [TypeScript Playground](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play)

### Similar Libraries

If you need additional utility types, check out:

- [type-fest](https://github.com/sindresorhus/type-fest) - Essential TypeScript types
- [utility-types](https://github.com/piotrwitek/utility-types) - Utility types complementing TypeScript
- [ts-toolbelt](https://github.com/millsp/ts-toolbelt) - TypeScript's largest utility library

### Learning Resources

- [TypeScript Exercises](https://typescript-exercises.github.io/)
- [Type Challenges](https://github.com/type-challenges/type-challenges)
- [Advanced TypeScript Patterns](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/2/types-from-types.html)

- **Discussions**: [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/kylepillay/typescript-utility-types/discussions)
